oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Prognosis in the downer cow syndrome
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Andrews, A. H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Differential diagnosis
Paralysis
Parturient paresis
cows
downer cows
down
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The recumbent cow presents many problems to the veterinary surgeon, not least of these is the one of prognosis. Prognosis can never be completely accurate, but it can be determined on average statistics, the signs presented, the continued reassessment of the animal, biochemical enzyme and level changes and the attitude of the stockman. The recumbent cow around the time of calving can be affected with one of a large number of different conditions.
